column1: BBC News NI outlines the latest data on coronavirus and Covid-19 vaccinations across Northern Ireland and the Republic of Ireland.Two further Covid-19-related deaths have been reported in Northern Ireland on Tuesday.Deaths are measured by recording those who died within 28 days of receiving a positive result in a test for coronavirus.  The total number of deaths linked to Covid-19 in Northern Ireland since the start of the pandemic is 2
column3: 585 new cases of coronavirus were reported in Northern Ireland on Tuesday
column5: 464 on Monday.That includes cases confirmed from samples taken in recent days
column6: not necessarily just in the latest 24-hour reporting period.On Tuesday
column7: there were 341 Covid inpatients in hospitals across Northern Ireland
column8: up from 340 on Monday.Twenty-nine people were being treated in intensive care units (ICU)
column9: up from 28 on Monday. Last updated 30 November at 14:00 GMTSource: Department of Health Northern IrelandA total of 3
column11: 662 vaccines for Covid-19 had been administered in Northern Ireland as of Tuesday.1
column13: 796 of the jabs were first doses
column17: 539 were third doses of the vaccine.   The remainder were booster jabs. Last updated 30 November at 14:00 GMTSource: Department of Health Northern IrelandAnother 4
column18: 607 cases of coronavirus were reported in the Republic of Ireland on Monday
column20: 735 on Sunday.The total number of deaths linked to Covid-19 in the Republic of Ireland since the start of the pandemic is 5
